channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree in front of stile on footpath, 4th April
item.description:
Someone plant a tree in worst place as it’s in front of footpath next to stile. Is anywhere to move to more appropriate place rather then in the place where people and dogs walks and difficult to get access to the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Football goal with net, 4th April
item.description:
Net is danger to wildlife, cats ect. There’s foxes and cats around the area. It’s has been left there over few months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Trench across the raod sinking., 4th April
item.description:
I raised this previously under ref: 7362621. Thsi reference has been closed, but the trench still remains. This is dangerous. You have to cross the white line to avoid damage to your car. Plaese don't close this task until you have fixed the sinking trench. Original report below. Two trenches across the road are sinking fast. To avoid the dip, you now need to cross the central white line. Obviously it is now a case of avoid the pothole, but risk on coming vehicles. There are two trenaches that need immediate action. Why has this not been picked up by Highways road inspection ? All very concerning, when huge amounts of money are being wasted on a cycle path, when the roads don't get fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road from mini roundabout heading to Reddings park, 4th April
item.description:
